description:
An AI named Matsumoto appears before Vivy, the world’s first autonomous humanoid AI. Matsumoto’s mission is to rewrite history together with Vivy, in order to stop the war between AI and humans that will happen one century later.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: ヴィヴィ -フローライトアイズソング-
วีวี่ บทเพลงจักรกลกู้ศตวรรษ

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2275305008) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=takuma_ebisu)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Currently an integral part of [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/)'s main staff. Massive fan of robots and mecha.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2275305008) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=takuma_ebisu)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Currently an integral part of [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/)'s main staff. Massive fan of robots and mecha.

[Website (FLAT STUDIO)](http://flatstudio.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/loundraw) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=772547) | [Tumblr](http://loundrawblr.tumblr.com)

Illustrator who made his professional debut in his teens with a cover illustration for Gara Nagata's _Hoshi no Nemuru Mizuumi e -Ai wo Sagashi ni-_. He also worked on the covers of various novels, such as Keigo Higashino’s _Koi no Gondola_ and Yoru Sumino’s _Kimi no Suizou wo Tabetai_.

He is also active in other creative areas like music, where he is part of the artist group CHRONICLE. At the end of 2016, he published his first art book ‘Hello, light. ~loundraw art works~’.

In January 2019, he established the animation studio FLAT STUDIO with [Tetsuya Sano](https://anilist.co/staff/126059/Tetsuya-Sano) also joining the studio.

In February of 2021 he launched "PROJECT COMMON", a multimedia project with the theme of "expressing the true loundraw"

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/kosaki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_kosaki)

A Japanese composer and arranger. He joined NAMCO as a soundtrack composer in 1999, and then he joined MONACA Inc. as a music designer in 2004.

Soundtracks he has worked on credited as MONACA: 
- Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takuto (with Keigo Hoashi and Ryuichi Takada) 
- Hourou Musuko (with Keigo Hoashi and Keiichi Okabe) 
- A-Channel (with Kakeru Ishihama, Ryuichi Takada, Keigo Hoashi)

[Website](https://yagikairi.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kairiyagi_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/reu__loon/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpuMbQe3VhIpg22sbNbHQKQ/)

Born in Hiroshima on September 5th, 2002, Kairi Yagi moved to Tokyo alone at age 15 to pursue her dream, quickly gaining popularity on YouTube from song covers.
Her singing as the main character [Vivy](https://anilist.co/character/209903) from April 2021 TV-anime series [Vivy -Fluorite Eyeʼs Song-](https://anilist.co/anime/128546) was widely acclaimed, earning the No.1 spot on RecoChoku newcomers download charts for the first half of 2021.
She marked her debut with her first original single, "Ripe Aster" on December 18th, 2021.
Masaharu Yamanouchi is a music producer.
